title.narrative: Promote IB in natural ingredient sectors

description.narrative:
This project is designed to enhance and diversify livelihood of poor ethnic farmer communities in Ha Giang and Lao Cai provinces through establishing and promoting responsible and inclusive business models in those provinces# natural ingredient sectors (atiso, hàth# ô, tam th#t, ##ng sâm, huy#n sâm, ## tr#ng, xuyên khung, ô ##u (#u t#u), th#o qu# và ###ng quy). As a result, Vietnam can protect the biodiversity and natural resources; enhance poor community#s livelihoods and enterprises# business performance, enable a favorable legal framework for the sector#s sustainable development and Vietnam can become an internationally recognized supplier of goodquality natural ingredients.
The four specific objectives of project are: (1) small scale farmers and SMEs in Ha Giang and Lao Caiare promoted to adopt and practice sustainable and good agricultural production practice towards GACP-WHO certificate of Ethical BioTrade. (2) Sustainable and inclusive business models in natural ingredient sectors developed and piloted in Ha Giang and Lao Cai province through the farming contracts between processing companies, collaborative farmers groups. (3) Advocating and supporting to local authorities and enterprises in Ha Giang province for legal framework favoring responsible investment, sustainable sourcing and processing of natural ingredients with effective participation of other related stakeholders (NGOs, communities, scientists).
To achieve the aforementioned goal, the project will carry out several interventions including value chain assessment and analysis, capacity building for small scale producers, Technical assistance for selected SMEs, Establishing and strengthening market linkages and promoting inclusive business, Policy influencing, Documentation, knowledge and workshop sharing to promote Inclusive business.

participating-org.narrative: The Research Centre for Non Timber Forest Products (NTFPRC) is a state scientific organzation under the Vietnamese Academy of Forest Science. It has legality and legal entity to reserve the right to use their own stamp and open their own account at Vietnam StateTreasury and bank for operation according to Vietnam#s regulation. NTFPRC has function of research, technology transfer, international cooperation and consultant service. It participates in training about non timber forest product over the country, under the regulation. The organizational structure of NTFPRC includes: Department of Administration and Acounting, Department of Non Timber ForestProducts Resource Management Division, Department of NTFP breeding and cultivation technology; Department of NTFP harvesting and post-processing technology, Department of NTFP chemistry, and Hoanh Bo experimental research station at Quang Ninh province with 227 hactares of forest and forest land, Bao Yen Rattan and Bamboo research station at Lao Cai province with 202 hectares of forest and forest land. The Headquarter located at No 8, Chuong Duong Do street, Hoan Kiem district, Hanoi.
